channel.title: Server crash
channel.description:
people keep crashing the server im admin on and i want to know what they are dooing becaus ei need to make a code to stop them from doing it,
its not npc attking cat or mass
what is it?
its keeping the server down for a while

item.title: Server crash
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Fine, then I wont bother.

Read full topic

item.title: Server crash
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:5, topic:45898”][quote author=lothy link=topic=63717.msg753461#msg753461 date=1168341381]
Oh, and Javac. A try catch should do the trick. Just make it catch anything other then using items on players, and return a sendMessage saying that you can’t use items on NPCs.
I’ll take a look now, never even thought something like this existed.
[/quote]

I mean fixing it so that you actually could implement using items on NPCs[/quote]
Oh. =\ I hardly see the point in that though… For quests, maybe. But other then that it’s mostly useless.

Read full topic

item.title: Server crash
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:4, topic:45898”]Oh, and Javac. A try catch should do the trick. Just make it catch anything other then using items on players, and return a sendMessage saying that you can’t use items on NPCs.
I’ll take a look now, never even thought something like this existed. :O[/quote]

I mean fixing it so that you actually could implement using items on NPCs

Read full topic

item.title: Server crash
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Flooding the server with connection requests.[br][size=1]Posted on: 09 January 2007, 17:12:57[/size][hr][quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:3, topic:45898”]No, not null attacking. Most likely, they are using inventory items on NPCs. The server misinterprets it as an attempt to attack a nonexistant player and crashes with an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. I will be releasing a tutorial on how to fix item on NPC later this week if I ever decide to figure it out.[/quote]
Oh, wow. So it hasn’t just been me going around causing chaos. :P[br][size=1]Posted on: 09 January 2007, 17:13:56[/size][hr]Oh, and Javac. A try catch should do the trick. Just make it catch anything other then using items on players, and return a sendMessage saying that you can’t use items on NPCs.
I’ll take a look now, never even thought something like this existed.

Read full topic

item.title: Server crash
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

No, not null attacking. Most likely, they are using inventory items on NPCs. The server misinterprets it as an attempt to attack a nonexistant player and crashes with an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. I will be releasing a tutorial on how to fix item on NPC later this week if I ever decide to figure it out.

Read full topic

item.title: Server crash
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Which server?[br][size=1]Posted on: 09 January 2007, 16:59:36[/size][hr]I’d help, but people could use it against me…[br][size=1]Posted on: 09 January 2007, 17:07:17[/size][hr]They’re just null attacking, lol.

Read full topic
